title: Nootokka Jillala Andagadu
text:
Nootokka Jillala Andagadu () is a 2021 Indian <a href="Telugu%20language">Telugu</a>-language <a href="comedy-drama">comedy-drama</a> film directed by Rachakonda Vidyasagar. It is written by <a href="Srinivas%20Avasarala">Avasarala Srinivas</a> who stars alongside <a href="Ruhani%20Sharma">Ruhani Sharma</a>. The film is produced by <a href="Sri%20Venkateswara%20Creations">Sri Venkateswara Creations</a> and <a href="First%20Frame%20Entertainments">First Frame Entertainments</a>. The plot follows Gotti Surya Narayana (Avasarala), a 37-year old bachelor with a <a href="Hair%20loss">bald head</a>. Principal photography of the film started in 2019 but its production and release were delayed due to the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic">COVID-19 pandemic</a>. It was released on 3 September 2021.
Plot.
An unmarried young man named Gotti Surya Narayana "GSN" manages his premature baldness by wearing a wig.
Production.
The film was officially launched in October 2019 in <a href="Hyderabad">Hyderabad</a> with a traditional <a href="Puja%20%28Hinduism%29">pooja</a> ceremony. It has begun its production in end of 2019 but was halted due to the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic">COVID-19 pandemic</a>. The shoot was resumed in September 2020, following the ease of <a href="COVID-19%20lockdown%20in%20India">COVID-19 lockdown in India</a>. Avasarala plays Gotti Surya Narayana, a 37-year old bachelor who has a bald head. Ruhani Sharma plays his love interest. The makers have denied the speculations that the film was a remake of the Hindi film <a href="Bala%20%282019%20film%29">"Bala"</a> (2019), stating it was conceived before the latter's release. The film is presented by <a href="Dil%20Raju">Dil Raju</a> and <a href="Krish%20Jagarlamudi">Krish Jagarlamudi</a>.
The film's title "Nootokka Jillala Andagadu" is adapted from actor <a href="Nutan%20Prasad">Nutan Prasad</a> catchphrase from "<a href="Chali%20Cheemalu">Chali Cheemalu</a>" (1978).
Soundtrack.
The film has score and soundtrack composed by Shakthikanth Karthik released on Mango Music. The first single "Nootokka Jillala Andagadu" was released in April 2021, which featured lyrics written by <a href="Bhaskarabhatla">Bhaskarabhatla</a> and vocals by Simha. The soundtrack album consists of five singles.
Release.
The film initially was scheduled for release on 7 May 2021. It was later rescheduled as 27 August, and subsequently 3 September 2021. A pre-release event was conducted on 30 August 2021.
Reception.
Sangeetha Devi Dundoo of "<a href="The%20Hindu">The Hindu</a>" wrote that: ""Nootokka"… is well intentioned and handles issues with sensitivity. But it doesn’t have the spark with which Avasarala wrote "<a href="Oohalu%20Gusagusalade">Oohalu Gusagusalade</a>" and "<a href="Jyo%20Achyutananda">Jo Atchyutananda</a>"." Dundoo appreciated the performances of Avasarala, Sharma and Rohini, and opined that the latter was capable of making a difference in crucial scenes. "<a href="The%20Times%20of%20India">The Times of India</a>" critic Sravan Vanaparthy rated the film 3/5 and wrote: "Nootokka Jillala Andagadu is a popcorn entertainer with a message to convey about body shaming."
Anji Shetty of <a href="Sakshi%20%28newspaper%29">"Sakshi"</a> praised the performances of Avasarala and Sharma, and opined that humour and emotions were main drivers of the film. Shetty, however, felt that routine story and climax have let down the film. A reviewer from "<a href="Eenadu">Eenadu</a>" also echoed the same, writing that director Vidyasagar's flat narration style could not carry the screenplay and emotion properly. "<a href="Namasthe%20Telangana">Namasthe Telangana</a>" critic lauded the novel attempt by the makers but felt that screenplay was not convincing enough. 
Suresh Rachamalla of <a href="News18%20Telugu">News18 Telugu</a>, on the other hand, stated that the writing, direction and performances have done justice for the film. "<a href="Samayam%20Telugu">Samayam Telugu</a>" reviewer Sekher Kusuma also wrote that the screenplay was gripping and entertaining, while also appreciating the music and choreography.
